processed.result: You are given an array of $n$ integers ($2 \le n \le 200000$).  You can replace any element in the array with any integer.  What is the minimum number of replacements needed to make the array almost increasing? An array is almost increasing if you can remove at most one element and the remaining array is strictly increasing (each element is greater than the one before it).

You are given a list of numbers. You can change any number to any other number. What is the fewest changes needed to make the list so that each number is bigger than the one before it, except for at most one number.
